snippet: Spending an estimated $1 billion to sponsor and advertise during the Olympics in Sochi, Russia, marketers hope that multiple issues threatening to overshadow the Games won’t repel consumers.
abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column notes that advertisers have spent some $1 billion on exposure at the Olympics, where they hope that multiple issues threatening to overshadow Winter Games will not repel American consumers.
lead_paragraph: Spending an estimated $1 billion to sponsor and advertise during the Olympics in Sochi, Russia, marketers hope that multiple issues threatening to overshadow the Games won’t repel consumers.

headline.main: Fingers Crossed, Marketers Count on Olympic Gold
